chef_short_description: Award-winning chef with a passion for Mexican mix fusion cuisine

recipes.cooking_method: 1. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high hea. 2. Add the ground beef and cook until browned and cooked through, breaking it up with a spoon as it cooks. 3. Add the taco seasoning and stir to combine. 4. In a large bowl, combine the chopped lettuce, cherry tomatoes, shredded cheese, and crushed tortilla chips. 5. Add the cooked ground beef and stir to combine. 6. In a small bowl, mix together the sour cream, salsa, and chopped cilantro. 7. Serve the taco salad with the sour cream mixture on top.

ingredients: 2. 1 can (15 oz) black beans, rinsed and drained,
recipes.cooking_method: 1. Preheat the oven to 350°F. 2. In a large bowl, combine the shredded chicken, black beans, salsa, cilantro, cumin, and chili powder. 3. Wrap the tortillas in a damp paper towel and microwave for 30 seconds to soften. 4. Place a spoonful of the chicken mixture onto each tortilla, roll up, and place seam-side down in a 9x13 inch baking dish. 5. Sprinkle  cheese over the top of the enchiladas, followed by the sliced olives and chopped green onions. 6. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

1. Preheat the broiler, 2. Place the poblano peppers on a baking sheet and broil for 5-10 minutes, turning occasionally, until the skins areblackened and blistered. 3. Remove the peppers from the oven and place them in a plastic bag to steam for 10-15 minutes. 4. In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, cooked rice, shredded cheese, chopped onion, minced garlic, cumin, chili powder, salt, and black pepper. 5. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. 6. Bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly and the peppers are tender.
